Package model

Class Petrinet

java.lang.Object
model.Petrinet
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Comparable<Petrinet>
public class Petrinet
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable<Petrinet>
Class that represents a petrinet. A petrinet is a kind of state model whose elements are places and transitions. With the firing of a transition a state change is (typically) triggered in the petrinet. Such a state change consists in a different distribution of tokens across the petrinet's places.
Author:
Alexander Steinberg

  • Constructor Details

    • Petrinet

      public Petrinet()
      constructor for the Petrinet class. A petrinet is a kind of state model whose elements are places and transitions. With the firing of a transition a state change is (typically) triggered in the petrinet. Such a state change consists in a different distribution of tokens across the petrinet's places.

  • Method Details

    • getId

      public int getId()
      Returns:
      the petrinet's id

    • addPlace

      void addPlace​(Place place)
      Add the passed place to the petrinet. If the petrinet already contains a place with the same id, there will be no change in the petrinet.
      Parameters:
      place - to add

    • addPlace

      void addPlace​(java.lang.String id)
      Create a place with the id and add it to the petrinet. If the petrinet already contains a place with the id, there will be no change in the petrinet.
      Parameters:

    • addTransition

      void addTransition​(Transition transition)
      Add the passed transition to the petrinet. If the petrinet already contains a transition with the same id, the petrinet is not changed.
      Parameters:
      transition - the transition to add

    • addTransition

      void addTransition​(java.lang.String id)
      Create a transition with the passed id and add ir to the petrinet. If the petrinet already contains a transition with the id, the petrinet is not changed.
      Parameters:
      id - the id of the transition to add

      Parameters:

    • setTokens

      void setTokens​(java.lang.String id, int numberOfTokens)
      Set the number of tokens for the place with the passed id. If the petrinet does not contain a place with that id, the petrinet is not changed.
      Parameters:
      id - the id of the place
      numberOfTokens - the number of tokens to set

    • getPetriElement

      PetriElement getPetriElement​(java.lang.String id)
      Parameters:
      id -
      Returns:
      the petrinet element (place or transition) with the id, if it exists; null otherwise

    • setName

      void setName​(java.lang.String id, java.lang.String name)
      Sets the name of the element with the id. If the petrinet does not contain an element with that id, the petrinet is not changed.
      Parameters:
      id - of the element
      name - to set

    • setPosition

      void setPosition​(java.lang.String id, int x, int y)
      Sets the position of the element with the id. If the petrinet does not contain an element with that id, the petrinet is not changed.
      Parameters:
      id - the id of the element
      x - the horizontal position
      y - the vertical position

    • getPlaces

    • setState

      public void setState​(PetrinetState petrinetState)
      Sets the petrinet to the passed state. In particular, the configuration of tokens is taken from the passed petrinet state. Assumes that the petrinet state passed is a state of this petrinet.
      Parameters:
      petrinetState - the state to set the petrinet to

    • getPlaceById

      public Place getPlaceById​(java.lang.String id)
      Parameters:
      id -
      Returns:
      the place with the id, if it exists; null otherwise

    • togglePlaceSelected

      public Place togglePlaceSelected​(java.lang.String id)
      Sets the selected place of the petrinet to the place with the passed id. If there is no place with the id or if the place with the id is already selected, it sets the selected place to null.
      Parameters:
      id - the id of the place to toggle
      Returns:
      the new selected place if one is set, null otherwise

    • getSelectedPlace

      public Place getSelectedPlace()
      Returns:
      the selected place

    • getEnabledTransitions

      public java.util.Collection<Transition> getEnabledTransitions()
      A transition is enabled when all its input places have at least one token. Gets a collection of all enabled transitions in the petrinet.
      Returns:
      the collection of currently enabled transitions
